text_sections.section_12: It is an obstacle, but it can be overcome. The language of instruction in most degree courses at German higher education institutions is German. That is why you have to prove your knowledge of the language to be admitted. There are exceptions, though.
text_sections.section_18: Is German really necessary? Always ask!
text_sections.section_19: There are exceptions to every rule. If you are enrolled in an  (https://www2.daad.de/deutschland/studienangebote/international-programmes/en/) or in special postgraduate courses, German is not a prerequisite. And at some universities you do not need a fluency certificate if you only want to study for one or two semesters. However, this rule does not apply everywhere. Be sure to ask at the higher education institution of your choice.
text_sections.section_20: Language tests are your key to German universities
text_sections.section_21: If German is a prerequisite, you have to prove your knowledge of the language with one of two recognised exams. You can take the TestDaF language exam (Test Deutsch als Fremdsprache – „Test of German as a foreign language“) in your home country. It is offered in over 100 other countries as a paper-based and digital test. On the  (https://www.testdaf.de/de/) (German only) you will find exam locations and dates as well as information on the test structure and preparation options
text_sections.section_22: You can also take the so-called Deutsche Sprachprüfung für den Hochschulzugang DSH, or German Language Test for University Admission in Germany. Many universities offer this exam. The international office at your university will give you the dates.
text_sections.section_24: If you want to assess your knowledge of German, you can test yourself. There is a short, free placement test on the  (https://www.goethe.de/de/spr/kup/tsd.html?wt_sc=einstufungstest) . After completing the test, you will receive a recommendation as to which course level is suitable. If your knowledge of German is not yet sufficient, you can also attend a language course in Germany. Many universities offer language courses during the semester break. They take place in summer, usually between June and September. Some also offer language classes in the winter months. You can find more information here:  (https://www2.daad.de/deutschland/studienangebote/sommerkurse/en/?languageSwitched=1) .
